info.name: Ferrum Web Unified API Documentation: Authentication & File Management
info.description:
This comprehensive API documentation provides a single source of truth for managing user authentication and file operations. It details endpoints for user signup, login, and profile retrieval alongside endpoints for uploading, fetching, and downloading files. Designed for clarity and ease-of-use, the documentation includes request/response examples, parameter descriptions, and error handling guidelines to help developers integrate seamlessly with our services.

> **Base URL:**  
**`https://ferrum-web.onrender.com`** 
  

###### All endpoints described in this document should be appended to the above URL.

###### For example, if an endpoint is `/auth/login`, the full URL will be:

`https://ferrum-web.onrender.com/auth/login`

request.description: Retrieves details of the currently authenticated user by verifying the **JWT token** provided in the Authorization header.

response.name: User Does not Exist or Deleted
user ID is 0 or Null or Server fails to get user id

request.description: Authenticates a user using either their email or username along with a password. On success, returns a **JWT token** and the **username**.

header.value: jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6MzMsInVzZXJuYW1lIjoiZXhhbXBsZXVzZXIiLCJpYXQiOjE3NDM0OTY5ODcsImV4cCI6MTc0Mzc1NjE4N30.-XoNYFsFkv6SuO422SMPVWbYxg69zB6TbZtAIqCcbhg; Max-Age=259200; Path=/; Expires=Fri, 04 Apr 2025 08:43:07 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None

response.name: Missing Username or Password
response.body: Bad Request: Missing email_username or password.

request.description: generates a **new access token** using a **refresh token** stored in cookies.

response.name: Wrong Refresh Token or Server Error

request.description: Registers a new user. The endpoint accepts the user’s email, username, and password. The password is hashed before storing it in the database.
Retrieves metadata for all files associated with a specific user.

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {

request.description:
Uploads a **JSON** file and associates it with a user. If no user is provided, the file is uploaded with a default "**Guest**" user

_Note: Only files with a_ `.json` _extension and matching MIME type (\`__**application/json**__\`_) are allowed.
Downloads a file based on its file ID. This endpoint returns the file with proper headers so that it can be downloaded or displayed by the client.

response.name: Success Response (200 OK)
